candidates.definition: Geographic regions defined by governmental boundaries and administrative control.

positive_examples: The mayor announced new policies for the entire city.
Federal regulations apply to all states in the nation.
County officials voted on the local tax proposal.
The province implemented stricter environmental laws.
Municipal boundaries were redrawn after the census.
State governments coordinate with federal agencies.
negative_examples: The forest ecosystem spans multiple watersheds.
Climate zones vary significantly across the continent.
The mountain range extends for hundreds of miles.
Ocean currents affect coastal weather patterns.
The neighborhood association organized a block party.
Corporate districts house the city's major businesses.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: NaturalLandforms, GeographicRegions, EcosystemAreas, ClimateZones

candidates.definition: Land formations shaped by natural processes without human development or cultivation.

positive_examples: The Amazon rainforest spans across multiple countries in South America.
Sahara desert temperatures can reach extreme highs during the day.
Prairie grasslands stretch endlessly across the Great Plains.
Dense jungle vegetation made exploration nearly impossible.
The oasis provided fresh water for weary desert travelers.
Rolling hills of the piedmont region offer scenic mountain views.
negative_examples: The city park has well-maintained walking paths and benches.
Farmers planted corn across hundreds of acres of farmland.
The highway cuts straight through the valley between mountains.
Suburban neighborhoods filled the former wheat fields.
Golf courses require constant irrigation and landscaping maintenance.
The mining operation stripped away the topsoil completely.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: UrbanAreas, AgriculturalLand, DevelopedProperty, TransportationRoutes

candidates.definition: Land used for growing crops or farming activities

positive_examples: The farmer planted wheat across 200 acres of fertile farmland
Irrigation systems watered the vegetable fields during the drought
The orchard produced apples and pears on terraced hillsides
Rice paddies stretched across the valley floor
The vineyard covered the gentle slopes with rows of grapevines
Corn grew tall in the cultivated fields behind the barn
negative_examples: Cattle grazed peacefully in the open pasture
The hiking trail wound through the forest preserve
Wild flowers bloomed in the untouched meadow
The parking lot was paved with asphalt
Residential houses lined the suburban street
The golf course had perfectly manicured grass
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Pasture, Forest, UrbanLand, Wilderness, RecreationalLand

candidates.definition: Land areas defined by their relationship to water bodies, including boundaries, connections, and proximity to seas or lakes.

positive_examples: The rocky shoreline stretched for miles along the Atlantic coast.
Sicily is a large island in the Mediterranean Sea.
The narrow isthmus connects the two peninsulas across the bay.
We walked along the sandy beach at sunset.
Switzerland is completely landlocked by surrounding countries.
The harbor sits where the land meets the ocean.
negative_examples: The mountain peak towered above the valley floor.
Highway 101 runs through the central plains.
The forest trail wound through dense woodland.
Desert sands stretched endlessly in all directions.
The river carved a deep canyon through solid rock.
Urban sprawl covered the fertile farmland.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: MountainArea, DesertRegion, ForestLand, UrbanArea

candidates.definition: Designated land areas within or near settlements that serve specific community functions or activities.

positive_examples: The new park downtown will include playgrounds and walking trails.
They're building condominiums on the old city block near Main Street.
The cemetery on Oak Avenue has beautiful old oak trees throughout.
We reserved a spot at the campground just outside the city limits.
The municipal planning committee approved the new recreational area.
Families gathered at the community space for the summer festival.
negative_examples: The farmer planted corn across his entire agricultural field.
Wild deer roam freely through the untouched forest preserve.
The construction crew cleared the vacant lot for the new shopping center.
Hikers explored the remote wilderness area in the mountains.
The industrial complex spans several acres near the highway.
Ocean waves crashed against the rocky shoreline.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: WildLand, AgriculturalLand, IndustrialLand, WaterFront
